content: I'm looking to learn more about antique furniture restoration. I recently started taking classes and I'm working on refinishing an old oak coffee table. I was wondering if you could provide some general tips on how to identify the type of wood and the best ways to remove old finishes. By the way, I've been really getting into antiques lately - I even found an old armchair from the Victorian era at an estate sale three weeks ago that I had reupholstered.
